fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28415].
  {panel}

(!) Please note that there is a recent problem discovered with Chrome that produces the same symptoms and is being tracked in the following ticket. Please follow the workaround instructions there: [Page Editor shows at half height on Chrome|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-41035]
h2. Fixed in 5.1.3
We've put a fix for the Chrome bug in Confluence 5.1.3, upgrading to this release will fix the problem. Confluence OnDemand already has this fix and is not impacted. 

For people who can't immediately upgrade, there is a CSS workaround you can apply. We will shortly be releasing a plugin to do this automatically for you.

h2. Fixed via Plugin

The [Editor Height Fix for Confluence Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor-height-fix] automatically adds the CSS mentioned in the workaround below.

You can install it directly through the product (search for Editor Height Fix). 

NB: You may need to set your [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts] back to default if you are still experiencing the issue after performing these steps.

h2. Workaround if plugin cannot be installed.
You can apply some custom CSS to resolve the issue. 

NB: You may need to set your [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts] back to default if you are still experiencing the issue after performing these steps.

h4. Steps for Confluence 4.x

h6. Global Stylesheet
This will fix the bug in all Spaces using the default theme:
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Confluence Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button on the 'Global Stylesheet' screen
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h6. Space Stylesheet
For spaces using the Documentation, Easy reader, or a custom theme, you need to apply the CSS change to them individually:
* Navigate to the space
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Space Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h4. Steps for Confluence 5.x

h6. Global Stylesheet
This will fix the bug in all Spaces using the default theme:
* Click the 'Cog' in the header and click 'Confluence Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button on the 'Global Stylesheet' screen
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h6. Space Stylesheet
For spaces using the Documentation, Easy reader, or a custom theme, you need to apply the CSS change to them individually:
* Navigate to the space
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Space Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h4. CSS snippet
{code}
/* CONF-28415 */
form.editor .editor-default,
.editor-fullheight {
    height: 100%;
    height: auto\9; /* IE8 */
}
{code}


Steps to reproduce:
* Open any page for editing
* What happens:
** Editor does not take the full height of the container area. Content of the editor are clipped. (see attachment)
* What should happen:
** The editor must take all the available height of the container area.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28402].
  {panel}

When attempting to move an attachment from one page to another (via Tools-> Attachments -> (filename) -> Properties), the search widget that used to exist (for helping to find the name of the target page) is no longer visible in at least Confluence 5.0.1+.

Specifically, in the "Page" field on the Properties page, there is no longer any auto-suggest feature or "magnifying glass" search tool for finding target pages. One needs to know and enter the exact page name of the target page in order to move an attachment there.

If you enter an incorrect page name, you will be presented with a solid red "error" box (which can be found to be hiding the underlying red-on-red error message by selecting the text with the cursor, as seen in the screenshot).

This also makes it practically impossible to move an attachment to a blog post, since the "path" to a blog post is not particularly obvious, and entering just the title of the blog post does not work.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28377].
  {panel}

The creator column in the CONTENT_PERM should not be null unless the user that caused that record to be added was really anonymous.

For reference see:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-95615
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/133543/space-admin-page-restrictions-creator-shows-as-anonymous-when-it-isn-t-bug

To confirm, Adrien Ragot (Atlassian) in answers confirmed it was a bug:

"I have just noticed a small bug: When you use the Restrictions dialog to add several groups, the first group always appears in CONTENT_PERM with CREATOR = NULL and all the other groups have a value in CREATOR."

Bruna Griebeler (Atlassian) also mentioned was a bug when she said in the support ticket:

"As we talked yesterday, this is the query to set the creator as the lastmodifier user, to avoid let the creator as null, for security reasons.

update CONTENT_PERM set CREATOR=LASTMODIFIER where creator=NULL;

PS: Please create a backup of your database before running that query!!
About the bug itself, I'll talk with a developer and will let you know as soon as possible."

In the support ticket, the customer indicated that they would like to see a resolution that does not involve having to run a SQL update frequently.

Without a customer workaround, this bug basically disables the ability for the space administrator to audit changes properly.
fields.summary: null CREATOR inserted in CONTENT_PERM

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28367].
  {panel}

Slash ('/') is not escaped in the Page title when navigated to via WebDAV. Instead, anything past the '/' will be seen as a new directory.

+*Example:*+
Space title is "TEST/SPACE" and key "TS", so its Home Page title is "TEST/SPACE Home". When WebDAV is trying to navigate to it, the directory tree will be seen as: 
/default/Global/TS/TEST/SPACE Home
instead of
/default/Global/TS/TEST\/SPACE Home

(white space doesn't seem to be a problem though)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28360].
  {panel}

Currently we have no way to hook into the [Macro Property Panel|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Extending+the+Macro+Property+Panel] creation which is based on the macro descriptor.

{code}
    <xhtml-macro key="status" name="status"
                 class="com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.status.StatusMacro"
                 icon="/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.status-macro/images/status-icon.png">
        ...
        <property-panel>
            <spacer/>
            <button id="subtle" label="Subtle"/>
            <spacer/>
            <button id="Grey" label=""/>
            <button id="Red" label=""/>
            <button id="Yellow" label=""/>
            <button id="Green" label=""/>
            <button id="Blue" label=""/>
            <button id="Brown" label=""/>
            <spacer/>
        </property-panel>
    </xhtml-macro>
{code}

A use case would be to be able to add additional CSS classes for a button in order to steer its visual appearance, e.g. the _selected_ class. Since we require to wire up the code via JS anyway, the easiest way would be to allow the registration of callbacks able to modify the buttons before they get attached to the DOM. This is an easier to implement and flexible approach than changing the descriptor to allow additional CSS classes on the property-panel elements, as this would be static by default and I'd assume that for the majority of use cases you'd need to assert a state at runtime.
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I want to be able to modify the generated property panel after creation

This comes from a post on [Answers.Atlassian.com|https://answers.atlassian.com/] which I believe would be a valid feature.

[Is there a way to disable notifications in a space?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/143231/is-there-a-way-to-disable-notifications-in-a-space?page=1#143633]

The use case would be that a company has multiple spaces but has a specific space which contains sensitive information that they would not like to have traveling over the internet via email.  However, they would still like to be able to have this ability available for spaces which do not contain sensitive information.  So the idea would be say an option in the space admin screens (say a check box) that when checked stops all emails related to that space from being created.

*workaround in the meantime*
Add a filter at the mail server level which blocks emails which contain links to the space in question.  For example 'http://localhost:8090/display/TEST' so they are still created by Confluence but never actually get sent.
fields.summary: Block emails/notifications from a specific space

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28313]. {panel} Sometimes macros are reasonably simple in terms of what they output, e.g. the [Status Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Status+Macro]. In order to approximate to [WYSIWYG|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WYSIWYG], the only choice these macros currently have is to use the [EditorImagePlaceholder|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Providing+an+Image+as+a+Macro+Placeholder+in+the+Editor] in order to create an image of the rendered output. This is suboptimal for several reasons: * Browsers render HTML/CSS slightly differently, the image output will always be just an approximation * There are no good JVM-based HTML/CSS render engines out there, the best bet would be to either use [Flying Saucer|http://code.google.com/p/flying-saucer/] (only supports CSS 2.1) or to ship with one of the Browser's rendering engines (e.g. WebKit wrapped in QtWebKit via [Qt-Jambi |http://qt-jambi.org/] Any solution using this approach will be unnecessarily complex when the goal is to just use the output of the macro in the editor. There is also a CustomHtmlEditorPlaceholder interface available, but the implementation is also restricted to img and object tags. I've identified the following reasons for why the editor applies these restrictions so far: * the custom HTML should not be editable, as it gives the user the impression that whatever he puts inside the placeholder will be persisted for the page, but that code is just "thrown away" * images are single elements without a text node, thus the cursor never jumps in, and drag&drop is easy to implement As for the first restriction, imo that should be a decision made by the plugin developer. One possible implementation I envision for this is to utilize TinyMCE's [noneditable|http://www.tinymce.com/tryit/noneditable_content.php] to signalise the user that the content is not editable. Also this plugin has its quirks, if the user somehow gets into the placeholder and starts editing the only effect is that this edit gets lost. If that happens often we can iterate on making the plugin better or even add supplying JS signalising the user that he's in the wrong spot. As for the second restriction, it is easy to identify the placeholders root element as it contains all the attributes a normal macro contains in the editor (e.g. data-macro-name), thus Drag&Drop should be relatively easy to implement for that. I'd suggest modifying the CustomPlaceholderEditorMarshaller to allow custom HTML beyond and
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I want to render the output of my macro in the editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28312].
  {panel}

We currently need configurations like 

{code}
    <web-resource key="page-editor-js" name="Confluence Page Editor Javascript resources only" i18n-name-key="admin.web.resources.plugin.js.page.editor.name">
...
        <transformation extension="soy">
            <transformer key="soyTransformer"><functions>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.soy:soy-core-functions</functions></transformer>
        </transformation>
...
        <resource type="download" name="image-dialog-soy.js" location="/includes/soy/image-dialog.soy">
            <param name="source" value="webContextStatic"/>
        </resource>
...
    </web-resource>
{code}

or

{code}
    <web-resource name="Status Resources" key="editor_status">
        <transformation extension="less">
            <transformer key="less-transformer"/>
        </transformation>
...
        <resource type="download" name="status.css" location="css/status.less"/>
    </web-resource>
{code}

even though it's obvious that you need a Soy or LESS transformer based on the extension. 

I'd suggest implementing a global transformation registry to be used by a decorated WebResourceModuleDescriptor in order to append to the list returned from  getTransformations. This implementation should filter duplicates and issue a warning (in dev mode) if the descriptor contains transformations which are already covered by the global registry, encouraging the plugin developer to remove those (unless backwards-compatibility has to be maintained). The global registry should only contain transformations which are operate on their distinctive file extensions (e.g. *.less and *.soy).
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I want to use transformers like Soy and LESS automagically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28297].
  {panel}

With Confluence on Demand it is not possible to have duplicate page names in one specific space. This is due to architectural/programming decisions by atlassian.

In the Marketplace there is an extension from k15t.com which provides the functionality for Confluence Users which install the product on their own server.

So basically it is possible to have duplicate page names as long as the page permalink is unique.

Further details about the extension which does this functionality is to be found here:
http://www.k15t.com/display/en/2012/11/08/Duplicate+Page+Titles+in+Confluence+for+Everyone

REQUEST:
Atlassian should add the possibility to have duplicate page names ASAP as we need to have structure with repeating page names like:

DVD Authoring
  - Overview
  - Authoring
  - Testing

Blu-ray Authoring
  - Overview
  - Authoring
  - Testing

etc.

As the On Demand Confluence product does not allow to install extensions from the marketplace, we are dependent solely on Atlassian to put this feature on the roadmap for future versions for the on demand product.

We think it is important for serious documentation of processes.

Thank you and kind regards

Sandro Barbieri

REDSMOKE PRODUCTIONS GmbH
Grabenstrasse 9
8952 Schlieren
SWITZERLAND

P: 0041 44 575 22 44
fields.summary: Allow Duplicate Page Names in same Space for Confluence on Demand Product

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28275].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 29 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Update: please refer to my [comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28275?focusedCommentId=648705&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-648705] for the latest status on this ticket.
----
Thanks for the continued feedback and completing the survey, which helped us understand your pain points with the current design. The majority (84%) of example logos provided were rectangular in shape, so simply preventing the rounding of space logos (as some requested) would not solve the problem for these 84%. Therefore, we have built a new uploader which works for both square and rectangular logos.

With the current uploader, you can only select a portion of a rectangular logo, e.g.:
!before.png!

With the new uploader, you can zoom out and crop ‘beyond’ the border of the image, allowing you to fit the entire logo in, e.g.: 
!after.png!

This works for a square logo as well, and allows you to adjust it inside the area that was previously clipped due to the circular mask.

These changes will be shipping in Confluence 5.6 and in a Confluence OnDemand update in the next few weeks.

Thanks again to all for your input and feedback, I'll now be marking this issue as closed.

Regards,
John
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}

With Confluence 5.0, rounding of space logos was introduced and enforced as the only option.

Some logos do not lend themselves to rounding and look quite bad with it. There should be a way to set space logos without modification as before.

h5. Workaround

For a workaround involving CSS (as well as background on why rounded logos were introduced), please see [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28275?focusedCommentId=450941&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-450941].
fields.summary: Provide a way to avoid the automatic rounding of space logos

We would like to upgrade to 25 user licenses for Confluence for the time being, and then later for JIRA.

Can we upgrade only Confluence to 25 users and leave JIRA to 10 users?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28262].
  {panel}

Hi,

as we try to construct a Confluence-based knowledge base to assist our user support we encountered a Stack-Trace quite similar to CONF-19117. The headline's length is caused by the inclusion of appropriate error-messages.

Steps to reproduce:
# From any page choose Tools -> Import Word Document
# Choose and upload a file containing headings of more than 255 character length e.g. [^exception.doc]
# Select the depth at which the overly long headings reside in "Split by heading"
# Hit "Import" and "Continue"
# Great 500-page

Suggestions to prevent this error:
- Immediately after choosing "Split by heading" check the result's title-lengths and prefix any overly long title by (!)
- Offer to change titles in configuration or confirmation step to fulfil requirements
- Change TITLE-column to "TEXT"-type (and maybe soft-limit to 512 or something)

Regards

Matthias
fields.summary: "Split by heading" fails with exception on long headings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28261].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Install Confluence in a machine that has no QuickTime installed
# Attach [^sample_mpeg4.mp4] into Confluence
# Embed it in Confluence page using Multimedia macro
# Set 'Autoplay' On
# Result: The mp4 file does not play

Looks like this is a problem with mp4 files in general, when QuickTime plugin is not installed in the system. This only happens when Confluence hosts the mp4 file. Saving the page to local hard drive (containing the multimedia macro) renders a proper behavior: The mp4 file is played despite not having QuickTime plugin installed. 

Can't figure out what might be causing this as the source code is exactly the same, local vs Confluence, with the exception of where the mp4 file is being played from (in Confluence, it's played from the attachments link, while in the local hard drive, the mp4 file is loaded from the hard drive itself).
fields.summary: mp4 file does not play when QuickTime plugin is not installed

I was typing on a big screen here on L16 for team meeting...

I used the KB shortcuts to insert row before and after to put some rows in ...

None of them had any idea they existed - they were like "How do you do that?..." 

Told them to look in the KB shortcuts dialog.. then I realised it isn't there!

https://skitch.com/sherif/8m5tf/skitched-20120321-142610

We should add the two shortcuts there - they are awesome, let's make them more discoverable!

Actually if we want just to export some pages in "Potrait" and some in "Landscape" we must put the pages in different space, because we can't have more than one stylesheet per space.
This restriction is very harmful, because often, some pages are larger than other according to table size.
[See support ticket CSP-96679 for more info|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-96679]

It would be very nice to have an option to choose Stylesheet when Exporting in PDF.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28238].
  {panel}

According to my tests with a Delegated LDAP, when a user logs in:
* We query the user's details twice
* We query the user's groups.

Environment:
* I looked at the requests with Wireshark,
* Delegated LDAP,
* Use Nested Groups (but beware of CONF-27032),
* Copy User on Login,
* Synchronize Memberships.
* See attached file: 1 group, 10 users, you'll see in the request that the 10 users appear when one logs in. [Tutorial to launch OpenLDAP on your machine|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Testing+with+OpenLDAP].

On a slow LDAP (my test instance with OpenLDAP and 100,000 users takes 18s to answer any simple query), this feels like a long login.

This issue is in Confluence but it is probably related to Embedded Crowd. I keep investigating. This is only a performance improvement.
fields.summary: The LDAP is queried twice for the user's details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28237].
  {panel}

A bug in the confluence-create-content-plugin released with Confluence 5.0 means that clicking the "Create" button in the header does not show the Create dialog as expected. Instead, the screen the user is on is reloaded.
***
Update - the cause of the bug has been identified and a fix should be released very shortly.

h3. Applying the Patch:

# Download the plugin attached to this ticket, which contains the fix for the problem.
# In Confluence, choose the cog icon at top right of the screen, then choose Confluence Admin. Then choose Add-ons > Manage Add-ons
# Click on the Upload Plugin link on the right hand side and upload the file downloaded on step 1.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28221].
  {panel}

When editing a document, Confluence thinks it's being clever by capturing ctrl-f and firing up it's own search panel. Personally I was happy with the search provided by my browser, but whatever.

The problem comes because Confluence isn't smart enough to also capture ctrl-g (search again, or find next, or whatever). So when I hit ctrl-g, the browsers search panel now opens. Typically the browser is searching for the string before last.

This is a real pain.

Could capturing ctrl-f be made optional (currently I see it isn't), or could you do the favour of also respecting ctrl-g?

kthxbi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28207].
  {panel}

This happens because of one of the following reasons:
1. Themes that are not supported by Confluence 5.0 are still applied to the instance and/or spaces.
2. The CSS customizing spaces in the previous version is not compatible with 5.0 because of the changes inserted by the [Atlassian Design Guidelines|https://developer.atlassian.com/design/].

In both cases, the problem can be fixed by following the steps suggested in Upgrade Notes:

* [Custom themes, layouts and CSS will probably break|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.0+Upgrade+Notes#Confluence5.0UpgradeNotes-Customthemes,layoutsandCSSwillprobablybreak]
fields.summary: After the Upgrade to 5.0 old themes and CSS customization mess the UI
